caption: We spent a very comfortable time with very good and friendly service, and the price was reasonable. The soup of the day we had was home-made style and was very nice with paprika and other vegetables as well as lots of melted cheese on top.

We had great food the last time we were at Le Petit Samaritan, so we are back & had the Beef Steak and Onion Soup. Their onion soup is really unique üëçüëç with a special flavour twist to it, and with a thick brothy texture. Truly enjoyed the soup ‚ÄºÔ∏è The beef steak was what brought the stars down. The beef, though med raw, was much too chewy for me üò•. But what helped was the ultra delicious mash served with the steak ‚≠êÔ∏è

It was super noisy, due to some sort of gathering; we could hardly hear each other. The food was kind of mid, the confit de canard was a bit dry, the other food I tried was not exciting. The mousse au chocolat was absolutely terrible, neither of us who ordered it had more than a taste before giving up. It was like eating cold, dense cake frosting. The waitress was friendly and efficient.

Have to say that it‚Äôs very badly cooked.  Very oily, reheated Fries, very overcooked frozen fish.  Don‚Äôt know why it has rating 4.6 on google . I think it‚Äôs worth a 3.5/5 for the price it takes. Not much service either .
lovely hidden French place we visit after the Louvre. Quiet and authentic.

We came to Le Petit Samaritain multiple times during our trip to Paris because the food and the service is excellent. We tried almost everything on the menu and enjoyed every bite! You really can‚Äôt go wrong with anything you order here.

We stopped here for lunch before going to Le Louvre. The food was superb and the service was excellent. You can tell a lot of love and attention are paid to the dishes. I would highly recommend this restaurant!
Fantastic restaurant. Ambiance is perfect, tucked away from crowds. Georgina was an incredible hostess and made the whole experience great. Merci beaucoup!

It is a big mistake to come to Paris without eating in this restaurant. It was easily the best meal I've had in my life. If I will ever be on death row I will order Le Petit Samaritain's foie gras, poulpe, and confit canard as my last meal. Merci!

Food was amazing! We had the confitted duck with mashed potatoes and the burguer, both were phenomenal.  Also the lady was kind to recommend a good wine and check on us regarding the food. The desserts are also a must. Amazing creme brule and lemon tart.
Hidden gem in Paris. Underrated restaurant. Everything is home made with quality products. Great wine options from small producers. Quality /price ratio is 10/10.

Delicious! Lovely little bistro tucked away in a side street by the Samaritain department store. Family run, friendly service and lots of yummy homemade French classics plus an excellent wine list. We will be back.
Great food and amazing chef/owner! A little off the beaten path with a great vibe inside. Had the buratta salad and octopus with risotto and would order it again.
What an amazing food!!! I would rate 10 stars if I could!!!  Everything beyond perfection! The flavors, the presentation, the service‚Ä¶ it was a great experience for us ‚ô•Ô∏èen

We found it by chance and enjoyed a unique lunch. The restaurant was on a quiet street and had very good service and very reasonable prices. On the menu, you will find specials on a combination of the main course with dessert or appetizer. We ordered Piece du Boucher and Quasi De Veau which were excellent with a delicious sauce but the creme brulee at the end was amazing.  Tips: the restaurant is only open for lunch

Highly recommend this place. Fresh ingredients, beautiful garnish and the most important- amazing taste ! The Staff was nice and extremely helpful, happy to recommend You the House specials. If you are looking for more local experience Le Petit Samaritan is definitely the place for You.

This was one of our favorite restaurants in Paris and a very short walk from the Louvre. Tucked away on a quiet street, as we entered, we were warmly greeted by the owner. Her kindness and hospitality made us feel right at home and she even helped me with my French!  The food is amazing! I had the confit de canard that was tr√®s d√©licieux and literally fell right off the bone. I did not know that les pommes de terre could taste so good. And of all the places we tried during our visit to Paris, I feel that Le Petit Samaritain's cr√®me br√ªl√©e was le meilleur!
Really well cooked French dishes in very good prices. Great desserts too! Excellent service, they really helped us by speaking English!

Maybe I‚Äôm an anomaly - I‚Äôm vegetarian, no meat, no fish. I had the Linguini without Chicken, and it was so average. The portion was very less, but filling because it was a lot of cheese with pasta. There were barely any mushrooms in it - almost looked shredded. So I paid the complete ‚Ç¨19 for it with nothing but cheese and pasta. There was some confusion about bottled or tap water, so we ended paying for that also. Please be careful and stress what you want, sometimes I feel it might have been intentional but I can‚Äôt say. My friend had a prawn dish and she liked it, though we thought this place is very overpriced and missable. Among all the places we‚Äôve eaten, including a random Sushi and some Chinese place one the go when we were super hunger and that was the closest thing around, this was the worst. It was also empty at dinner time.
The service was excellent, approchable, and attentive. The best steak tartare we tried in Paris, and the duck confit was delicious. Sincerely recommended.
Excellent little restaurant!! My family and I ate here and everything we had was delicious. Would highly recommend the food and chocolate milkshake!
The she (the server) was kind and cheerful. Had a great time with great suggestions of food and desserts. Will highly recommend.

There was nowhone in the restaurant, that should of warned us...didn't like onion soup, lamb was very chewy, badly cooked. Waiter was -mah. Food was overpriced...All in all, wouldn't go there ever again.

Reasonably priced place for awesome food. Tried the duck confit /‚Äúpreserved duck‚Äù on the EN menu and Cr√®me br√ªl√©e for 21 EUR.  Not sure how the fries were done but they were splendid - crispy yet soft at the same time.

It‚Äôs off the beaten path only a couple blocks away from the Seine. We had the best lunch, duck & fries or mash potatoes. Couple of my kids had burger & fries, so everyone was happy. It‚Äôs nice & quiet out of the tourist hustle & bustle. The desserts were amazing to finish our meals. We ate here after visiting the Louvre.
The cafe is a relaxing vibes all staffs are super friendly. All the food we ordered it was amazing ü§© Definitely we will go back again next time in Paris. üëçüèªüëçüèª
Great place! Personnel is welcoming, helps to navigate among typical dishes in the menu, open on Sunday. Needless to say the food is delicious
Good food‚Ä¶ elegant, tasty, home made and smiling and caring staff! Do not hesitate ‚Ä¶ the prices are fair for the neighborhood

This my second visit having first lunched here in March and I strongly recommend coming here is you like good food! Lots of traditional French flavours with a slight twist (the photo is my pumpkin cr√®me br√ªl√©e) and great wine. The service is excellent too and prices very reasonable for what you get.
Highly recommend this petite but comfy restaurant ‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èThe dish of the day is excellent‚ò∫Ô∏è‚ò∫Ô∏èthe dessert is SO GOODüíõüíõüá´üá∑üá´üá∑üá´üá∑c‚Äôest tr√®s bon! ‚Ä¶
We love it here! Sweetest staff and the most delicious food and ambiance! It‚Äôs a must!
The beef steak (35 ‚Ç¨) is very hard to chew. I ordered ‚Äúmedium‚Äù, the steak served is almost ‚Äúwell done‚Äù. Also, no bread served.
Such a wonderful array of options. Our family of 5 tried all different dishes plus appetizers, all very tasty and fresh!
Cozy and nice place. Tasty food and warm attendance. Definitely I  come back to Petit Sam.

I would like to stand out the Fricass√© de rognons and two desserts: the Cr√®me Brul√©e and the Tartelette. But if i you wonder me about the better: a attentive and hepful service.  If you are going to visit Paris, enjoy Le Petit Samaritain.

This place is a true hidden treasure. The food is delicious and reasonably priced. The location is very chill and quiet despite a very busy area around. And the service is    humble and respectful spiced with a good sense of humor.
It was surprisingly empty when we visited but a very warm welcome and we ate well.   It's well hidden but worth a visit.
Magnificent lunch today for a very reasonable price, considering the location close to the Louvre - and a very charming manager (she told me I had to write :-) And she really is)
